page.title: 01TAYVALLICH - NORTH KNAPDALE
page.content: This block shows typical Snapdale topography - parallel ridge and valleys, rocky moorland, heather, forestry plantation. Population (roughly 130, 1/3 employed, 1/4 retired) is concentrated in Tayvallich - a natural anchorage attracting many summer visitors. There is no unemployment, many travel to work, some in Lichgilphead. Tayvallich has three churches, three small farms (rough grazing; caravan parks) an inn employing several, a licensed store/post office, a blacksmith/welder, resident nurse, daily postal service, one weekly bus to Lovhgilthead (most have private cars), mains water, electricity, street lighting, automatic telephones, septic tank drainage. Several small boats fish daily from Tayvallich for shell-fish, mainly prawns. One boat
